titleInfo.title: Letter from Lewis Pelly, Bombay to Earl Canning, Viceroy of India

mods.abstract: Letter regarding the travelling expenses incurred by Pelly from Tehran to Herat, and from there through Afghanistan to Beloochistan [Baluchistan] and Kurrachee [Karachi] which amounted to £265 for the period September to December 1860.The letter goes on to give breakdowns of how this money was spent, including £80 on acquiring political information, paying servants, and gifts to local rulers and ministers.The letter concludes by expressing Pelly's hopes that the expenditure will not seem extravagant to His Lordship and enquiring again after the amount of salary he should draw for the duration of his special duty.
